titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Thomas P. Elliott papers, 1834-1872

repository.label: Repository

did.abstract: Personal letters of Thomas P. Elliott, with descriptions of a train ride in 1834, a trip to the Middle West, and school life at Westtown School, near Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Thomas P. Elliott Papers, 1834-1872, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Thomas P. Elliott was a resident of Northhampton County, North Carolina.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Personal letters of Thomas P. Elliott, with descriptions of a train ride in 1834, a trip to the Middle West, and school life at Westtown School, near Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
